title: Newport Pagnell Walks

images.title: River Lovat by the Battery by Philip Jeffrey, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: River Lovat (Ouzel) by the Battery. John Bunyan, author of Pilgrim’s Progress, served in the town as a garrison soldier in 1643. Traces of the garrison’s fortifications can still be seen today.

images.title: Bench and path through Castle Meadow by Philip Jeffrey, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Bench and path through Castle Meadow

images.title: John Winfield / Newport Pagnell from Great Ouse meadows
images.caption: Newport Pagnell from Great Ouse meadows

images.title: River Great Ouse by Geographer, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: River Great Ouse

images.title: St.John Street, Newport Pagnell by Geographer, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons

images.title: nick macneill, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Tickford Bridge, Newport Pagnell with parish church in background. The Grade I listed Tickford Bridge, over the River Ouzel (or Lovat), was built in 1810

images.title: Richard Schmidt / Reflections of Old Age
images.caption: Reflections of Old Age. Tickford Bridge in Newport Pagnell is the oldest iron bridge in the country still carrying vehicular traffic.

images.title: Richard Schmidt / St Peter's and St Paul's
images.caption: St Peter's and St Paul's. The parish church in Newport Pagnell stands proud at the top of the hill. The church has been described as the Cathedral of North Buckinghamshire.

description: This Buckinghamshire based town is located on the eastern side of Milton Keynes. There's some lovely local parks and riverside trails to enjoy in this scenic area. The town also has a fascinating history with a fine old church and a noteworthy ancient bridge to see. This short walk in the town takes you to the River Great Ouse and the pretty Ousebank Gardens on the River Ouzel. You can then cross the river to visit Castle Meadows where there are some pleasant footpaths. Ousebank Gardens are very pretty with wildlife, picnic areas and nice views of the old church. To continue your walking around Newport Pagnell head west to visit the lovely Linford Lakes where you can enjoy waterside trails along the Grand Union Canal. Just to the south there's Willen Lake, an excellent place for easy walks and bird watching near the town.

details.subtitle: Pubs/Cafes
details.content: The King's Arms is a nice place for refreshment after your exercise. They do a fine Sunday lunch and have a lovely large garden area to relax in on warmer days. There's also a good selection of ales and a large car park. You can find them on Severn Drive at a postcode of MK16 9BY for your sat navs.

details.subtitle: Dog Walking
details.content: The local park and meadows make for a pleasant dog walk. The King's Arms mentioned above is also dog friendly.

display_address: Horton Road, Tickford End, Milton Keynes, City of Milton Keynes, England, MK16 8AN, United Kingdom
